trans-unit.source: Represents the control that redistributes space between columns or rows of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> control.
The GridSplitter control redistributes space between rows or columns in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>, without changing the dimensions of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>.

For example, when a GridSplitter resizes two columns, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.ActualWidth%2A> property of one column is increased while at the same time the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.ActualWidth%2A> property of the other column is decreased by the same amount.

The following table shows how to define a horizontal or vertical GridSplitter by setting the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> properties and by leaving the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeDirection%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeBehavior%2A> properties set to their default values.

**How to create vertical and horizontal GridSplitter controls** |GridSplitter type|<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> value|<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> value| |-----------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |Resizes rows|<xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment>|<xref:System.Windows.VerticalAlignment>, <xref:System.Windows.VerticalAlignment>, <xref:System.Windows.VerticalAlignment>| |Resizes columns|<xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment>, <xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment>, <xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment>|<xref:System.Windows.VerticalAlignment>| |If <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualHeight%2A> is greater than or equal to <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualWidth%2A>, this resizes the columns.

If <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualHeight%2A> is less than <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualWidth%2A>, this resizes the rows.|<xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment>|<xref:System.Windows.VerticalAlignment>| A GridSplitter can overlap a row or column that contains other content, or it can occupy a row or column by itself.

For more information about how to define a GridSplitter, see [How to: Resize Rows with a GridSplitter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [How to: Resize Columns with a GridSplitter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

If the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> property settings do not achieve the desired GridSplitter behavior, you can change the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeDirection%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeBehavior%2A> property settings.
A GridSplitter may be obscured by other objects that are contained in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.Children%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>.
For information about how to prevent this situation, see [How to: Make Sure That a GridSplitter Is Visible](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the minimum distance that a user must drag a mouse to resize rows or columns with a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control.
The minimum distance that is defined by DragIncrement is reinitialized continually as the user drags the mouse.
For example, when you drag the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> by the DragIncrement amount, the rows or columns are resized.
To resize the rows and columns more, you must drag the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> the same amount.
Therefore, changes to column and row sizes that are made by using the mouse or the keyboard to move the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> are made in multiples of the DragIncrement.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A value that represents the minimum distance that a user must use the mouse to drag a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> to resize rows or columns.
The default is 1.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.DragIncrement*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the distance that each press of an arrow key moves a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The distance that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> moves for each press of an arrow key.
The default is 10.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.KeyboardIncrement*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates the implementation of <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GridSplitterAutomationPeer"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip"></xref> control.
Called when a key is pressed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control loses keyboard focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Responds to a change in the dimensions of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> control determines what type of pointer to display after its <xref:System.Windows.Size> is set.
Information about the change in size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref>.

Gets or sets the style that customizes the appearance, effects, or other style characteristics for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control preview indicator that is displayed when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ShowsPreview*> property is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
When you set styles, there are some restrictions.
For more information, see [Styling and Templating](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values `ResourceExtension` One of the following: `StaticResource` or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
`StyleResourceKey` The key that identifies the style being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
> [!NOTE] > Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended.
See [Inline Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A binding reference using or <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> is also possible, but uncommon.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| A preview of changes to row or column boundaries is displayed while the user drags the control, and the property is set to `true`.
The column and row boundaries are set when the user releases the mouse button.

Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> for the preview indicator that shows the potential change in <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> dimensions as you move the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control.
The default is the style that the current theme supplies.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.PreviewStyle*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.PreviewStyle%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets which columns or rows are resized relative to the column or row for which the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control is defined.

To specify a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> that resizes rows or columns, set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> properties.

If you cannot achieve the desired behavior by setting the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> properties, change the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeDirection%2A> or ResizeBehavior default values.
For more information, see [How to: Resize Rows with a GridSplitter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [How to: Resize Columns with a GridSplitter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
One of the enumeration values that indicates which columns or rows are resized by this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridResizeBehavior"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeBehavior*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeBehavior%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control resizes rows or columns.

To specify a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> that resizes rows or columns, set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> properties.

If you cannot achieve the desired behavior by setting the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> properties, change the ResizeDirection or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeBehavior%2A> default values.
For more information, see [How to: Resize Rows with a GridSplitter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [How to: Resize Columns with a GridSplitter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether to resize rows or columns.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridResizeDirection"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ResizeDirection*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> control updates the column or row size as the user drags the control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> requires an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> object to be present in its parent tree in order to display drag preview feedback.

This requirement is typically met by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> object that is available in the default style for the <xref:System.Windows.Window> or in the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> object that is created by a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> object.
However, if neither of these is available, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> control must define its own <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> object.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| When the ShowsPreview property is set to `true`, a preview of the change in the row or column sizes is shown.
The actual size changes when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> is released.
If the property is set to `false`, the column or row sizes are updated in real time as the user drags the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> control.
If the keyboard is used to move the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter> control, column or row sizes are updated in real time even if the ShowsPreview property is set to `true`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter"></xref> preview is displayed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridSplitter.ShowsPreview*> dependency property.
To be added.
